Both self.conv1 and self.downsample layers downsample the input when stride != 1 self.conv1 = conv3x3(inplanes, planes, stride) self.bn1 = norm_layer(planes) self.relu = nn.ReLU(inplace=True) self.conv2 = conv3x3(planes, planes) self.bn2 = norm_layer(planes) self.downsample = downsample # ä¸‹é‡‡æ ·å±‚ self.stride = stride def forward(self, x: Tensor) -> Tensor: identity = x out = self.conv1(x) # å·ç§¯å±‚ out = self.bn1(out) # BNå±‚ out = self.relu(out) # reluå‡½æ•° out = self.conv2(out) # å·ç§¯å±‚ out = self.bn2(out) # BNå±‚ if self.downsample is not None: identity = self.downsample(x) # ä¸‹é‡‡æ ·ï¼Œä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯Identity Mapping out += identity out = self.relu(out) # reluå‡½æ•° return out class Bottleneck(nn.Module): expansion: int = 4 def __init__( self, inplanes: int, planes: int, stride: int = 1, downsample: Optional[nn.Module] = None, groups: int = 1, base_width: int = 64, dilation: int = 1, norm_layer: Optional[Callable[..., nn.Module]] = None, ) -> None: super().__init__() if norm_layer is None: norm_layer = nn.BatchNorm2d width = int(planes * (base_width / 64.0)) * groups # Both self.conv2 and self.downsample layers downsample the input when stride != 1 self.conv1 = conv1x1(inplanes, width) self.bn1 = norm_layer(width) self.conv2 = conv3x3(width, width, stride, groups, dilation) self.bn2 = norm_layer(width) self.conv3 = conv1x1(width, planes * self.expansion) self.bn3 = norm_layer(planes * self.expansion) self.relu = nn.ReLU(inplace=True) self.downsample = downsample self.stride = stride def forward(self, x: Tensor) -> Tensor: identity = x out = self.conv1(x) # 1x1 å·ç§¯å±‚ out = self.bn1(out) # BNå±‚ out = self.relu(out) # reluå‡½æ•° out = self.conv2(out) # 3x3 å·ç§¯å±‚ out = self.bn2(out) # BNå±‚ out = self.relu(out) # reluå‡½æ•° out = self.conv3(out) # 1x1 å·ç§¯å±‚ out = self.bn3(out) #
